content.p: Except as provided in Paragraph B of this Article, an individual who is unable to pay the costs of court because of poverty and lack of means may prosecute or defend a judicial proceeding, including a succession proceeding, in any trial or appellate court without paying the costs in advance or as they accrue or furnishing security therefor.

In the event any person seeks to prosecute a suit in a court of this state while incarcerated or imprisoned for the commission of a felony without paying the costs in advance as they accrue or furnishing security thereof, the court shall require such person to advance costs in accordance with the following schedule: Prisoner's Present Assets Advance Cost To Be Paid Minimum Maximum Minimum Maximum Amount Amount Amount Amount $ 0.00 $ 20.00 $ 0.00 $ 3.00 $ 20.01 $ 45.00 $ 3.00 $ 9.00 $ 45.01 $ 65.00 $ 9.00 $ 15.00 $ 65.01 $ 85.00 $ 15.00 $ 21.00 $ 85.01 $ 105.00 $ 21.00 $ 27.00 $ 105.01 $ 125.00 $ 27.00 $ 33.00 $ 125.01 $ 145.00 $ 33.00 $ 39.00 $ 145.01 $ 165.00 $ 39.00 $ 45.00 $ 165.01 $ 185.00 $ 45.00 $ 51.00 $ 185.01 $ 205.00 $ 51.00 $ 57.00 $ 205.01 $ 225.00 $ 57.00 $ 63.00 $ 225.01 $ 245.00 $ 63.00 $ 69.00 $ 245.01 $ 265.00 $ 69.00 $ 75.00 $ 265.01 $ 285.00 $ 75.00 $ 81.00 $ 285.01 $ 305.00 $ 81.00 $ 87.00 $ 305.01 $ 325.00 $ 87.00 $ 93.00 $ 325.01 $ 345.00 $ 93.00 $ 99.00 $ 345.01 $ 365.00 $ 99.00 $ 105.00 $ 365.01 Up $ 105.00 to all advance cost.
